intro: Stemodia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's stemodia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and adaptations to arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
